Zanata dev team has continuously helped I18n team and Infra team
to setup our translation system with open source software Zanata [1].

Change-Id: If261702326fb1c7058056b3883b7416021189771
"}]
commit_message:
[I18n] Add Zanata dev team as extra ATC

Zanata dev team has continuously helped I18n team and Infra team
to setup our translation system with open source software Zanata [1].
Also, they collect our requirements for Zanata and enhance Zanata.
Since they are not translator, they do not satisfy our standard
ATC requirements, but I'd like to add them as extra ATC
in honor of their Zanata development.

[1] https://translate.zanata.org/

Change-Id: If261702326fb1c7058056b3883b7416021189771

subject: Limit OSD object name lengths for Jewel + ext4
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-17 09:26:53.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/ceph_hooks.py', 'templates/ceph.conf'], 'message': "Limit OSD object name lengths for Jewel + ext4

As of the Ceph Jewel release, certain limitations apply to
OSD object name lengths: specifically if ext4 is in use for
block devices or a directory based OSD is configured, OSD's
must be configured to limit object name length:

  osd max object name len = 256
  osd max object namespace len = 64

This may cause problems storing objects with long names via
the ceph-radosgw charm or for direct users of RADOS.

Also ensure that ceph.conf as a final newline as ceph requires
this.

Change-Id: I26f1d8a6f9560b307929f294d2d637c92986cf41
Closes-Bug: 1580320
Closes-Bug: 1578403
"}]
commit_message:
Limit OSD object name lengths for Jewel + ext4

As of the Ceph Jewel release, certain limitations apply to
OSD object name lengths: specifically if ext4 is in use for
block devices or a directory based OSD is configured, OSD's
must be configured to limit object name length:

  osd max object name len = 256
  osd max object namespace len = 64

This may cause problems storing objects with long names via
the ceph-radosgw charm or for direct users of RADOS.

Also ensure that ceph.conf as a final newline as ceph requires
this.

Change-Id: I26f1d8a6f9560b307929f294d2d637c92986cf41
Closes-Bug: 1580320
Closes-Bug: 1578403

subject: Wrong container name in devstack "All-In-One Single LXC Container" manual.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-17 08:37:43.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/guides/lxc.rst'], 'message': 'Wrong container name in devstack "All-In-One Single LXC Container" manual.

Wrong container name in devstack "All-In-One Single LXC Container" manual.

Link: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/guides/lxc.html

After creating "devstack" container with below command
sudo lxc-create -n devstack -t ubuntu -f devstack-lxc.conf -- --packages=bsdmainutils,git

The name should be 'devstack' instead of 'p2' in the below command
ssh ubuntu@$(sudo lxc-info -n p2 | awk '/IP/ { print $2 }')).

Change-Id: I7a84b97b03b2dd4338f1d946b7eafb8ec6e3767d
Closes-bug: #1582248
'}]
commit_message:
Wrong container name in devstack "All-In-One Single LXC Container" manual.

Wrong container name in devstack "All-In-One Single LXC Container" manual.

Link: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/devstack/guides/lxc.html

After creating "devstack" container with below command
sudo lxc-create -n devstack -t ubuntu -f devstack-lxc.conf -- --packages=bsdmainutils,git

The name should be 'devstack' instead of 'p2' in the below command
ssh ubuntu@$(sudo lxc-info -n p2 | awk '/IP/ { print $2 }')).

Change-Id: I7a84b97b03b2dd4338f1d946b7eafb8ec6e3767d
Closes-bug: #1582248

Forced backup was failing when the driver returned a 'provider_location'
for a cloned volume, because the return value for create_cloned_volume()
was ignored in _create_temp_cloned_volume().

Change-Id: I709996316e4c212243629e461d36da4152e995e4
Closes-Bug: 1573126
(cherry picked from commit 616a2bd34dee74931ead0d40596da98191ba6f77)

commit_message:
Add provider_location to cloned volume

Forced backup was failing when the driver returned a 'provider_location'
for a cloned volume, because the return value for create_cloned_volume()
was ignored in _create_temp_cloned_volume().

Change-Id: I709996316e4c212243629e461d36da4152e995e4
Closes-Bug: 1573126
(cherry picked from commit 616a2bd34dee74931ead0d40596da98191ba6f77)

This includes the base support matrix files as well as the library

commit_message:
Document PowerVM driver functions in support matrix doc

Add a copy of Nova's support matrix document within the docs for
nova-powervm. Within each section a powervm option has been added,
denoting whether or not each feature is currently supported.

This includes the base support matrix files as well as the library
and conf changes required to build it in the nova-powervm docs build.

Change-Id: I46511c61ce35164ec89098c6d876edb26ca8d261

commit_message:
Fix calculation of role dependency for environment settings

User should be able to turn off a setting if there are no deployed
or ready for deployment nodes in environment with a role,
which depends on this setting.

Closes-Bug: #1581506

Change-Id: I732c6b64a7cd90b73162789231255c29006bb21f

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-29 21:16:06.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/deploy.sh'], 'message': 'Wait for mysql cluster in HA job

The overcloud pingtest sometimes starts executing before the mysql
cluster is fully up and syncd in the HA job. This can result in various
errors during the pingtest, but typically results in an 500 Internal
Server Error returned since the database is not usable by any services.

See the bug for more details.

Change-Id: Id00ae74da819b76a11b8fdc4dd9ab7456f7eb31b
Partial-Bug: #1563554
'}]
commit_message:
Wait for mysql cluster in HA job

The overcloud pingtest sometimes starts executing before the mysql
cluster is fully up and syncd in the HA job. This can result in various
errors during the pingtest, but typically results in an 500 Internal
Server Error returned since the database is not usable by any services.

See the bug for more details.

Change-Id: Id00ae74da819b76a11b8fdc4dd9ab7456f7eb31b
Partial-Bug: #1563554

subject: Sort Flavors in Launch Instance by RAM (default)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-17 18:57:41.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/flavor/flavor.html'], 'message': "Sort Flavors in Launch Instance by RAM (default)

There was a bug in the logic for Flavors' listing in Launch Instance
that kept it from sorting by RAM (ascending).

You can verify this by going to Launch Instance and seeing that by default
the results are shown with the smallest RAM options first proceeding to
larger options.

Change-Id: I92b69284d50fc0ece7e19e2d75bb12349c66b86f
Closes-Bug: 1433317
"}]
commit_message:
Sort Flavors in Launch Instance by RAM (default)

There was a bug in the logic for Flavors' listing in Launch Instance
that kept it from sorting by RAM (ascending).

You can verify this by going to Launch Instance and seeing that by default
the results are shown with the smallest RAM options first proceeding to
larger options.

Change-Id: I92b69284d50fc0ece7e19e2d75bb12349c66b86f
Closes-Bug: 1433317

commit_message:
Add a cluster_network interface when we use ceph

Because of the consideration of security and performance, ceph community
recommend the use of two separate network public networks and cluster
networks. refer:
http://docs.ceph.com/docs/master/rados/configuration/network-config-ref/

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1582095
Change-Id: I8cb0e14f86c859820fbbb8af8f94ac8155338e13

commit_message:
Update auth_url for ceilometer controller noop

Patch I8de5e42102fed2de6bea7bbdd788e86a88f0354c is updating parameter
names for service_credentials section, hence we need to update library
noop tests as well. Also patch Ib30ab84b569ed26c0b7172365f8be39d9f244d2c
missed this change, hence we need to fix it.

Test will be enabled, when upstream patch will be merged.

Change-Id: I228bfe5c815a3a912ccac00c4db27522dcc5592f
Closes-Bug: #1582186

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-14 12:38:29.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/strategies/cluster/experimental/galera_common/api.py', 'trove/tests/unittests/cluster/test_galera_cluster.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-cluster-type-error-71cd846897dfd32e.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix MariaDB clusters failing with TypeError

This would apply to any type of cluster that uses the galera strategy
while setting the nics on a create call. When we called cast to set()
the object was a list of lists. The set method can not has a list so
this was causesing a unhashable error.

The change is to make the instance_nics a list of strings (what we
originaly expected) to resolve this issue.

Change-Id: I6b04f8b580720e5791e0977a9347d031cdbf9710
Closes-Bug: #1570602
'}]
commit_message:
Fix MariaDB clusters failing with TypeError

This would apply to any type of cluster that uses the galera strategy
while setting the nics on a create call. When we called cast to set()
the object was a list of lists. The set method can not has a list so
this was causesing a unhashable error.

The change is to make the instance_nics a list of strings (what we
originaly expected) to resolve this issue.

Change-Id: I6b04f8b580720e5791e0977a9347d031cdbf9710
Closes-Bug: #1570602

User should be able to turn off a setting if there are no deployed
or ready for deployment nodes in environment with a role,
which depends on this setting.

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-17 12:04:18.000000000', 'files': ['files/fuel-ha-utils/ocf/ns_conntrackd'], 'message': 'Refactor condition in "get_veth_pair"

* seems there is no need to have grep output,
  so added "-q"
* to prevent "false positive" "-w" key would
  prevent matching similar namespaces
* grep is a condition, so there is no need
  to do checks around return code
* try to use namespace in test expression

Closes-bug: #1582645

Change-Id: I7f38c2657541666c989f8e39e1c5a0e475d042f2
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor condition in "get_veth_pair"

* seems there is no need to have grep output,
  so added "-q"
* to prevent "false positive" "-w" key would
  prevent matching similar namespaces
* grep is a condition, so there is no need
  to do checks around return code
* try to use namespace in test expression

Closes-bug: #1582645

Change-Id: I7f38c2657541666c989f8e39e1c5a0e475d042f2

Due to fact that mirrors are not always up, there is very rare possibility
 that client will waste time of full bootstrap image building due to 2-3

commit_message:
Fix get_release_file retries

Due to fact that mirrors are not always up, there is very rare possibility
 that client will waste time of full bootstrap image building due to 2-3
 second downtime of a mirror. Also, due specific work-flow of fuel mirrors
 that may introduces instability to CI jobs.

Change-Id: Icecc1f4e355713ee95ac5e8d0d13ea326630c056
Closes-bug: #1563366
(cherry picked from commit b905e31ebf6311413069a18d6e8210869408264d)

subject: New workaround for Murano auth token expiry
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-18 23:58:23.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datasources/murano_driver.py', 'setup.cfg'], 'message': "New workaround for Murano auth token expiry

Murano client continues to use old auth token after refresh.
New workaround creates a whole new murano client instance with
new token.

Also changed program flow so that further 401 error after token
refresh are surfaced. The fact that 401 errors after token refresh
were suppressed was probably why the bug wasn't caught much earlier.

Change-Id: If628528c246090073fde1390e20a60e262b4ebbf
"}]
commit_message:
New workaround for Murano auth token expiry

Murano client continues to use old auth token after refresh.
New workaround creates a whole new murano client instance with
new token.

Also changed program flow so that further 401 error after token
refresh are surfaced. The fact that 401 errors after token refresh
were suppressed was probably why the bug wasn't caught much earlier.

Change-Id: If628528c246090073fde1390e20a60e262b4ebbf

commit_message:
Generate new wwpns on target host during evacuate

During evacaute of a instance using npiv volume use new wwpns on the
target host to make sure the connection to the disk is lost to the
instance running on source CEC if and when it comes back.

Change-Id: Ia2aaee6290097fe8dc8e18ab306ac57ba4f92f24
Closes-Bug: #1570697

subject: Generate only one pair of wwpns when instance has multiple block devices
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8190, 'name': 'Drew Thorstensen (thorst)', 'email': 'thorst@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'thorst'}, {'_account_id': 8662, 'name': 'Kyle L. Henderson', 'email': 'kyleh@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kyleh'}, {'_account_id': 13002, 'name': 'Shyama', 'email': 'shyvenug@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'shyama'}, {'_account_id': 14070, 'name': 'Eric Fried', 'email': 'openstack@fried.cc', 'username': 'efried'}, {'_account_id': 14806, 'name': 'Chhavi Agarwal', 'email': 'chhagarw@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'chhagarw'}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-02 10:16:44.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_npiv.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/npiv.py'], 'message': 'Generate only one pair of wwpns when instance has multiple block devices

During evacuate of instance with multiple block devices the npiv wwpns
method gets called multiple times and ends up generating wwpn pair each
time, but we need only one pair of wwpn for each fabric across all block
devices. The fix checks the fabric state in addition to the task state
to make sure the new wwpn pair is generated only once. Also the fabric
state of migrating should not be set on the instance since we are
regenarating new wwpn pair.

Closes-bug #1575135

Change-Id: I5d3079f8c3d86274028551d94ee59bf6f1617f89
'}]
commit_message:
Generate only one pair of wwpns when instance has multiple block devices

During evacuate of instance with multiple block devices the npiv wwpns
method gets called multiple times and ends up generating wwpn pair each
time, but we need only one pair of wwpn for each fabric across all block
devices. The fix checks the fabric state in addition to the task state
to make sure the new wwpn pair is generated only once. Also the fabric
state of migrating should not be set on the instance since we are
regenarating new wwpn pair.

Closes-bug #1575135

Change-Id: I5d3079f8c3d86274028551d94ee59bf6f1617f89

commit_message:
Makes tap device name consistent

Keeping device names used by Kuryr consistent with those used
by Nova makes the users' and operators' experience better. It
also makes debugging easier for those used to names employed by
Nova. This patch set changes the tap device name to use part of
the Neutron port id.

Closes-Bug: #1582348
Change-Id: I502f7bba09044106885de28cef8a432d5b5b1321

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-05-11 14:35:41.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/tests/fake_auth_provider.py', 'tempest/api/object_storage/test_object_services.py', 'tempest/services/object_storage/object_client.py', 'tempest/tests/services/object_storage/test_object_client.py', 'tempest/tests/services/object_storage/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Addresses Expect: 100-continue client behavior

Updates to the object storage object services cases with
Expect: 100-continue. The current test case sends data
along with the Expect: 100-continue header, which does
not properly mimic expected behavior. Updated the
method to send no body with the proper content length
along with the Expect header then sending the body once
the 100-continue is received.

Closes-Bug: #1573859
Change-Id: I91b486e067a0acacf7ca121e6d5da006554b5348
'}]
commit_message:
Addresses Expect: 100-continue client behavior

Updates to the object storage object services cases with
Expect: 100-continue. The current test case sends data
along with the Expect: 100-continue header, which does
not properly mimic expected behavior. Updated the
method to send no body with the proper content length
along with the Expect header then sending the body once
the 100-continue is received.

Closes-Bug: #1573859
Change-Id: I91b486e067a0acacf7ca121e6d5da006554b5348

commit_message:
Added task to install apt packages idependent of the cinder-volume backend

Packages needed by cinder-volume, idependent of the backend, were installed
only when using a LVM backend. This change adds a new task and variable for
installing/declaring packages commonly used between different cinder-volume
backends.

Change-Id: Idd7fd6f8be710c106210ec5bdc3ecda1071fc913
Closes-Bug: #1580222
(cherry picked from commit 956683b908fd0210289fb0110e50a3b7c95f3cef)

subject: First get to swift may fail
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-17 14:03:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/nvram/test_swift.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/nvram/swift.py'], 'message': 'First get to swift may fail

Swift client does not like easy errors.  The first call to swift to get
a container that is not there leads to an odd exception.

This change set will check first if the container exists (the first
time) before calling the exists.  This avoids another odd swift error.

Change-Id: I3eed06ddf1a8e50ddae42356c1b48a5f5df41304
Closes-Bug: #1582721
'}]
commit_message:
First get to swift may fail

Swift client does not like easy errors.  The first call to swift to get
a container that is not there leads to an odd exception.

This change set will check first if the container exists (the first
time) before calling the exists.  This avoids another odd swift error.

Change-Id: I3eed06ddf1a8e50ddae42356c1b48a5f5df41304
Closes-Bug: #1582721

commit_message:
First get to swift may fail

Swift client does not like easy errors.  The first call to swift to get
a container that is not there leads to an odd exception.

This change set will check first if the container exists (the first
time) before calling the exists.  This avoids another odd swift error.

Change-Id: I3eed06ddf1a8e50ddae42356c1b48a5f5df41304
Closes-Bug: #1582721

Use SSHManager for SSH access to slave nodes

Test cases and helpers now use Environment's
SSHManager instance for slave node SSH access.

Partial-Bug: #1566377

commit_message:
Reuse Cassandra connections

Cache and reuse the connections in the Admin and
Status objects to avoid leaking resources.
Initialize the App and Admin objects themselves lazily
at the first access.

The Connection object has been changed to act as both
an instance object and context manager.

Change-Id: I4263b870a1099d345ab1940c61ccdf4680a706ca
Closes-Bug: 1566946
(cherry picked from commit 728df1640f0db27fc541ad368341c98c1e77ef2c)

commit_message:
Update devstack install guide for stable branch

Existing install guide provides details on liberty
and mitaka is already released now. Instead of changing
liberty to mitaka, guide is updated to be generic enough
to install for the given stable branch.

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-05-17 09:02:25.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/request_spec.py', 'nova/tests/functional/db/test_request_spec.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': "Add a RequestSpec generation migration script

In Mitaka, we began to create and persist a RequestSpec object every time
a new instance was requested. Given that instances that were created before
that commit do not have a related RequestSpec, we needed to check
every time in the conductor methods whether the instance had a request spec
associated with it.

Now that we are in Newton, we can provide an online data migration script
that iterates over all the instances (using a marker), verify if the
RequestSpec object is created, and if not, try to persist into that object
the legacy fields we already know.

The marker uses the request_specs table for persisting itself, and
yes this is a hack, but that's the only solution we agreed for making sure
we were not looping every time on all the instances (which would be a
performance problem). When we finish looping over the instances, we
keep that marker so that the next call to that migration script
would not again iterate over all the instances (using the limit).

Change-Id: I61b9b50436d8bdb8ff06259cc2f876502d688b91
Partially-Implements: blueprint check-destination-on-migrations-newton
"}]
commit_message:
Add a RequestSpec generation migration script

In Mitaka, we began to create and persist a RequestSpec object every time
a new instance was requested. Given that instances that were created before
that commit do not have a related RequestSpec, we needed to check
every time in the conductor methods whether the instance had a request spec
associated with it.

Now that we are in Newton, we can provide an online data migration script
that iterates over all the instances (using a marker), verify if the
RequestSpec object is created, and if not, try to persist into that object
the legacy fields we already know.

The marker uses the request_specs table for persisting itself, and
yes this is a hack, but that's the only solution we agreed for making sure
we were not looping every time on all the instances (which would be a
performance problem). When we finish looping over the instances, we
keep that marker so that the next call to that migration script
would not again iterate over all the instances (using the limit).

Change-Id: I61b9b50436d8bdb8ff06259cc2f876502d688b91
Partially-Implements: blueprint check-destination-on-migrations-newton

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-01 19:58:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/api/test_bgp_speaker_extensions.py'], 'message': "Skip racy BGP tests and remove unnecessary use of LockFixture

This patch introduces the following changes to address race
conditions that can cause intermittent API test failures:

1. Tests related to floating IP's are subject to race conditions
   so skip them for now.
2. Tests that assert advertisement of tenant subnet prefixes now
   create BGP speakers with advertise_floating_host_routes=False
   so that they are isolated from tests that might concurrently
   perform CRUD on floating IP's.
3. Remove unnecessary use of LockFixture as it is gratuitous and
   and causes confusion. Use of LockFixture was left over from
   previous iterations of BGP where a BGP speaker and network
   binding was 1-to-1. Now that any number of BGP speakers can be
   bound to a network, use of LockFixture to protect BGP tests
   from each other is no longer necessary. Use of LockFixture was
   only intended to protect BGP tests from each other, not as a
   way to isolate them from all other tests.

Change-Id: Ied08ea24861393f4888389966891d3e7dfb1b3e3
Closes-bug: 1553374
"}]
commit_message:
Skip racy BGP tests and remove unnecessary use of LockFixture

This patch introduces the following changes to address race
conditions that can cause intermittent API test failures:

1. Tests related to floating IP's are subject to race conditions
   so skip them for now.
2. Tests that assert advertisement of tenant subnet prefixes now
   create BGP speakers with advertise_floating_host_routes=False
   so that they are isolated from tests that might concurrently
   perform CRUD on floating IP's.
3. Remove unnecessary use of LockFixture as it is gratuitous and
   and causes confusion. Use of LockFixture was left over from
   previous iterations of BGP where a BGP speaker and network
   binding was 1-to-1. Now that any number of BGP speakers can be
   bound to a network, use of LockFixture to protect BGP tests
   from each other is no longer necessary. Use of LockFixture was
   only intended to protect BGP tests from each other, not as a
   way to isolate them from all other tests.

Change-Id: Ied08ea24861393f4888389966891d3e7dfb1b3e3
Closes-bug: 1553374

commit_message:
Use keystone auth plugin

keystonemiddleware admin settings are deprecated
so we should stop using them in favor of a keystone
auth plugin. This patch updates the config file
to use keystone API v3 by default.

Change-Id: I9d10ac29ab33cbdd845573106960e5f181afdb69
Closes-Bug: 1579801

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-09 14:04:08.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'message': "remove instructions for submitting constraint update

This patch provides the ability for the registered detail views for
any resource type to be generically presented.

This patch does the following:
 * Adds a directive that displays a set of views (i.e. details sub-views)
 * Adds a Generic Detail display for routed pages
 * Adds the concept of a Descriptor which contains a resource type name
   and an identifier.  The identifier can be something as simple as
   a string, but may also be an object (if the resource type needs more
   than one value to look up its data, e.g. Pool Members)
 * Adds the ability for a resource type to have knowledge about how one
   of its items may be loaded, so any detail page can fetch the information
   given a basic context
 * Adds a generic Angular page (since they all just route to ng-views).
   We will see this used in subsequent patches as well.
 * Sets up a Django route to a non-navigational panel for the Details

Change-Id: Ie116b52ba196f9240fdc6bbc4a12d37beb9b9fcf
Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-registry
'}]
commit_message:
Generic details display framework

This patch provides the ability for the registered detail views for
any resource type to be generically presented.

This patch does the following:
 * Adds a directive that displays a set of views (i.e. details sub-views)
 * Adds a Generic Detail display for routed pages
 * Adds the concept of a Descriptor which contains a resource type name
   and an identifier.  The identifier can be something as simple as
   a string, but may also be an object (if the resource type needs more
   than one value to look up its data, e.g. Pool Members)
 * Adds the ability for a resource type to have knowledge about how one
   of its items may be loaded, so any detail page can fetch the information
   given a basic context
 * Adds a generic Angular page (since they all just route to ng-views).
   We will see this used in subsequent patches as well.
 * Sets up a Django route to a non-navigational panel for the Details

Change-Id: Ie116b52ba196f9240fdc6bbc4a12d37beb9b9fcf
Partially-Implements: blueprint angular-registry

subject: Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-12 20:15:28.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/conductor.pp', 'manifests/api.pp', 'manifests/init.pp', 'manifests/taskmanager.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/add_oslo_messaging_amqp-ee62f22b973da190.yaml', 'spec/classes/trove_api_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/trove_conductor_spec.rb', 'manifests/guestagent.pp', 'spec/classes/trove_guestagent_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/trove_taskmanager_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration

This commit adds support for the oslo.messaging amqp rpc_backend
which enables the AMQP 1.0 driver. A proposed feature for the
Newton oslo.messaging release is an update to the AMQP 1.0 driver
to support a stateless messaging interconnect for RPC traffic [1].

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::amqp resource
* add new parameters for the oslo_messaging_amqp driver
* update spec tests for amqp as alternate rpc_backend
* add feature release note

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/amqp-dispatch-router

Change-Id: I8306c56e86f2f8a8d6da1ecbf5eab674e6b1e8bf
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration

This commit adds support for the oslo.messaging amqp rpc_backend
which enables the AMQP 1.0 driver. A proposed feature for the
Newton oslo.messaging release is an update to the AMQP 1.0 driver
to support a stateless messaging interconnect for RPC traffic [1].

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::amqp resource
* add new parameters for the oslo_messaging_amqp driver
* update spec tests for amqp as alternate rpc_backend
* add feature release note

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/amqp-dispatch-router

Change-Id: I8306c56e86f2f8a8d6da1ecbf5eab674e6b1e8bf

commit_message:
Remove Container panel and action

According to decisions that Magnum becomes COE Management Service,
Magnum-UI should remove Container panel and actions that is for
Docker Swarm container manipulations.

This patch removes following items.
- Container views (table and detail)
- Container actions (create and delete)
- Create Container action from bay table view and bay detail view

Change-Id: Ia18e9fa57e0460b9b1a8b473a005d31cb4acc5ca
Implements: blueprint remove-container-panel

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-03 14:57:33.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/json-schema-for-versioned-object.rst'], 'message': 'versionedobjects: add json schema generation

Versioned objects have a well defined schema that is available
as python code. This schema can also be expressed in a python
independent way for example with JSON Schema. Nova uses versioned
object to define its notification interface. For the consumers of
the notifications it would be super awesome to have the schema
defined in a easy to process and python independent way.

Change-Id: I2073de230f1a74b275087fe7b0c2b4f5953c51b3
'}]
commit_message:
versionedobjects: add json schema generation

Versioned objects have a well defined schema that is available
as python code. This schema can also be expressed in a python
independent way for example with JSON Schema. Nova uses versioned
object to define its notification interface. For the consumers of
the notifications it would be super awesome to have the schema
defined in a easy to process and python independent way.

commit_message:
Remove 'verbose' option

This option was deprecated in oslo.log on Aug 1, 2015. We (Oslo) would
like to remove it now, which requires no-one reference it. This patch
removes mention of 'verbose' from Glance, except in cache_manage which
seems separate.

Change-Id: I8b9e5d3ce5fb19e77b637766f9280a499538cce3

commit_message:
Add support of alarm actions of notification

The api and client supports
alarm-actions, ok-actions, undetermined-actions.
But current monasca-ui supports only alarm-actions and
the other actions follow alarm-actions.
So this patch enables these actions are set respectively.

Change-Id: I07f187f84a78d7d0732ed64e921f7bd1f0ebb831
Closes-Bug: #1575748

commit_message:
Type checking in pool manager target sync

When this was originally written, zone.created_at was
a string as a result of some oslo.messaging logic,
at some time this has changed to a proper datetime
object. This handles both situations.

Change-Id: I561a21f5b9ffb22cb7ab84297d1029ea8505cda1

commit_message:
Switch to keystoneauth

This patch migrates designateclient to using keystoneauth Session
instead of deprecated keystoneclient's Session and plugins.

Also, this patch removes the old designateclient.auth module as it is
not used anywhere else in the code base and its purpose is overridden by
the fact that keystoneauth acts as an abstraction layer for
authentication (handling requests and reauthentication internally).

Change-Id: Ic3cc0fbb76977a04bab322ebcb1c818e75646772

commit_message:
Add cleanup operation to maintenance thread

JournalCleanup will delete "COMPLETED" rows where last_retried
is older than "completed_rows_retention" (can be changed in ml2_odl config).

This patch is based on the new maintenance thread infrastructure.

Change-Id: Ifa3bda3fcbff23ed313175582d461f09a3a7971f
Closes-Bug: #1567408

subject: Add python-designateclient as a mistral required package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-17 11:11:00.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.pp'], 'message': "Add python-designateclient as a mistral required package

Mistral recently landed actions to support designate, and currently
there is no way to blacklist actions you do not require, so we'll
have to install all clients until Mistral gains features to enable
selection of a subset of the built-in actions (this is expected
during newton I believe).

Change-Id: I8dffb0d3a7533675c82da5a2c71ccf354696b350
Closes-Bug: #1582651
"}]
commit_message:
Add python-designateclient as a mistral required package

Mistral recently landed actions to support designate, and currently
there is no way to blacklist actions you do not require, so we'll
have to install all clients until Mistral gains features to enable
selection of a subset of the built-in actions (this is expected
during newton I believe).

Change-Id: I8dffb0d3a7533675c82da5a2c71ccf354696b350
Closes-Bug: #1582651

Add a job to openstack/requirements to run the new validation command
that ensures that all repos listed in projects.txt have the
check-requirements job defined. The job only runs against the master
branch, for now. As we improve the reliability of the coverage we may
want to extend this to other branches in the future.

Change-Id: I4b0e8c1aca5e492d7f1d4a7f5c9f135569a27e1c
Depends-On: I61658a7265a77e72401978dda558f41b28a81d92
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
ensure all projects syncing global requirements use check-requirements

Add a job to openstack/requirements to run the new validation command
that ensures that all repos listed in projects.txt have the
check-requirements job defined. The job only runs against the master
branch, for now. As we improve the reliability of the coverage we may
want to extend this to other branches in the future.

Change-Id: I4b0e8c1aca5e492d7f1d4a7f5c9f135569a27e1c
Depends-On: I61658a7265a77e72401978dda558f41b28a81d92
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 20, 'created': '2016-05-16 07:49:11.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/magnum_keystone_domain_spec.rb', 'spec/acceptance/nodesets/centos-72-x64.yml', 'manifests/db/sync.pp', 'manifests/conductor.pp', 'manifests/api.pp', 'spec/classes/magnum_db_sync_spec.rb', 'manifests/db.pp', 'spec/classes/magnum_api_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/magnum_db_spec.rb', 'spec/acceptance/basic_magnum_spec.rb', 'manifests/certificates.pp', 'examples/magnum.pp', 'manifests/params.pp', 'manifests/keystone/domain.pp', 'manifests/client.pp'], 'message': 'Various fixes

- correcting "host_ip" entry to be "host" entry for magnum.conf
- correcting "userid" to be "rabbit_userid" entry inside magnum.conf
- db sync function
- beaker tests are working on Ubuntu as well
- update metadata.json with new openstacklib version
- as we don't have a database parameters in main class we don't want to pickup values from it inside db class

Adding:
- client class with client package installation
- examples folder with example which works with Mitaka release
- spec for db_sync
- adding nodesets spec for CentOS 7.2
- adding class and spec for creating user and domain for trust setup: http://osdir.com/ml/openstack-dev/2016-02/msg02123.html
- class to configure cert_manager_type properties

Known issues:
- In CentOS/RDP cannot create magnum bay due to the neutron issues: https://bugs.launchpad.net/magnum/+bug/1575524
- Trust domain and trust domain user has to be set to ID, not a names. Bug reported to magnum devs: https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-magnum/+bug/1581372

Change-Id: Ib923f79da691b5c71bb1c4efba8935c774598888
'}]
commit_message:
Various fixes

- correcting "host_ip" entry to be "host" entry for magnum.conf
- correcting "userid" to be "rabbit_userid" entry inside magnum.conf
- db sync function
- beaker tests are working on Ubuntu as well
- update metadata.json with new openstacklib version
- as we don't have a database parameters in main class we don't want to pickup values from it inside db class

Adding:
- client class with client package installation
- examples folder with example which works with Mitaka release
- spec for db_sync
- adding nodesets spec for CentOS 7.2
- adding class and spec for creating user and domain for trust setup: http://osdir.com/ml/openstack-dev/2016-02/msg02123.html
- class to configure cert_manager_type properties

Known issues:
- In CentOS/RDP cannot create magnum bay due to the neutron issues: https://bugs.launchpad.net/magnum/+bug/1575524
- Trust domain and trust domain user has to be set to ID, not a names. Bug reported to magnum devs: https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-magnum/+bug/1581372

Change-Id: Ib923f79da691b5c71bb1c4efba8935c774598888

commit_message:
Added ability for running tests.

* Configuration file shouldn't exist for running test.
* Class Configuration was refactored. If config file couldn't
  be found, object created with empty data. Exception isn't raised.

Change-Id: I614faa4cf17ae0c717d8ee9cad91ac8024924151
Partial-Bug: #1522353

subject: Make the version returned by the extension be the pbr version.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-17 12:44:36.000000000', 'files': ['os_api_ref/__init__.py'], 'message': "Make the version returned by the extension be the pbr version.

Let's not manage 2 versions in the files.

Change-Id: I22113ed0837ee49ef0ec90411cc0626dbbbbc304
"}]
commit_message:
Make the version returned by the extension be the pbr version.

subject: Allow to be case insensitive in the resource name definition
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7423, 'name': 'Cody Herriges', 'email': 'cody@herriges.org', 'username': 'ody'}, {'_account_id': 7745, 'name': 'Denis Egorenko', 'email': 'degorenko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'degorenko'}, {'_account_id': 9410, 'name': 'Yanis Guenane', 'email': 'yguenane@redhat.com', 'username': 'yguenane'}, {'_account_id': 15519, 'name': 'Iury Gregory Melo Ferreira', 'display_name': 'Iury Gregory', 'email': 'iurygregory@gmail.com', 'username': 'iurygregory'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-16 12:26:56.000000000', 'files': ['lib/puppet/provider/keystone_service/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_domain/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_user/openstack.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/keystone_role/openstack.rb'], 'message': "Allow to be case insensitive in the resource name definition

Keystone role insertion are case sensitive. That means that if we have a
role 'SwiftOperator' in keystone and try to add

keystone_role {'swiftoperator' : }

Keystone would fail with Error: Execution of '/bin/openstack role create
--format shell SwiftOperator' returned 1: Conflict occurred attempting
to store role - Duplicate Entry (HTTP 409)

The idea here is to allow the various keystone resources to be case
insensitive.

Change-Id: I49bc82f5b6a790d08a63807207bb7e2a813d71eb
"}]
commit_message:
Allow to be case insensitive in the resource name definition

Keystone role insertion are case sensitive. That means that if we have a
role 'SwiftOperator' in keystone and try to add

keystone_role {'swiftoperator' : }

Keystone would fail with Error: Execution of '/bin/openstack role create
--format shell SwiftOperator' returned 1: Conflict occurred attempting
to store role - Duplicate Entry (HTTP 409)

The idea here is to allow the various keystone resources to be case
insensitive.

Change-Id: I49bc82f5b6a790d08a63807207bb7e2a813d71eb

commit_message:
Added task to install apt packages idependent of the cinder-volume backend

Packages needed by cinder-volume, idependent of the backend, were installed
only when using a LVM backend. This change adds a new task and variable for
installing/declaring packages commonly used between different cinder-volume
backends.

Change-Id: Idd7fd6f8be710c106210ec5bdc3ecda1071fc913
Closes-Bug: #1580222

commit_message:
Add ensure_absent_val behavior to Nuage neutron plugin type

subject: Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-16 17:07:57.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/add_oslo_messaging_amqp-4ae1ae4234921ad3.yaml', 'spec/classes/ceilometer_init_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration

This commit adds support for the oslo.messaging amqp rpc_backend which enables
the AMQP 1.0 driver. A proposed feature for the Newton oslo.messaging release is an
update to the AMQP 1.0 driver to support a stateless messaging interconnect for
RPC traffic[1].

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::amqp resource
* add new parameters for the oslo_messaging_amqp driver
* update spec tests for amqp as alternate rpc_backend
* add feature release note

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/amqp-dispatch-router

Change-Id: I2095cee083c9ca2390df703ad6e3216e428989f9
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce support for oslo.messaging amqp driver configuration

This commit adds support for the oslo.messaging amqp rpc_backend which enables
the AMQP 1.0 driver. A proposed feature for the Newton oslo.messaging release is an
update to the AMQP 1.0 driver to support a stateless messaging interconnect for
RPC traffic[1].

This patch:
* use oslo::messaging::amqp resource
* add new parameters for the oslo_messaging_amqp driver
* update spec tests for amqp as alternate rpc_backend
* add feature release note

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+spec/amqp-dispatch-router

Change-Id: I2095cee083c9ca2390df703ad6e3216e428989f9

subject: Move files from mount points to actual file systems
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3009, 'name': 'Vladimir Kozhukalov', 'email': 'kozhukalov@gmail.com', 'username': 'kozhukalov'}, {'_account_id': 8003, 'name': 'Aleksandr Gordeev', 'email': 'agordeev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'agordeev'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9977, 'name': 'Aleksandra Fedorova', 'email': 'lp@bookwar.info', 'username': 'afedorova'}, {'_account_id': 13505, 'name': 'Igor Belikov', 'email': 'mail@igorbelikov.com', 'username': 'ibelikov'}, {'_account_id': 14200, 'name': 'Maksim Malchuk', 'email': 'maksim.malchuk@gmail.com', 'username': 'mmalchuk'}, {'_account_id': 19234, 'name': 'Alexey Stupnikov', 'email': 'aleksey.stupnikov@gmail.com', 'username': 'astupnikov'}, {'_account_id': 20656, 'name': 'Fuel Packaging CI', 'email': 'ci+fuel-packaging@mirantis.com', 'username': 'fuel-packaging-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-05-13 17:21:40.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/tests/test_manager.py', 'fuel_agent/utils/fs.py', 'fuel_agent/tests/test_fs_utils.py', 'fuel_agent/manager.py'], 'message': "Move files from mount points to actual file systems

The thing is that sometimes we have file system images and mount
point hierachies which are not aligned. Let's say, we have root
file system image, while partition scheme says that two file
systems should be created on the node: / and /var. In this case
root image has /var directory with a set of files. Obviously, we
need to move all these files from /var directory on the root
file system to /var file system because /var directory will be
used as mount point.
In order to achieve this we mount all existent file systems into
a flat set of temporary directories. We then try to find
specific paths which correspond to mount points and move all
files from these paths to corresponding file systems.

Co-Authored-By: Alexey Stupnikov <astupnikov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I1aa7523055ac4bcf6f8a93e9740ccf652ed35cc1
Closes-Bug: #1537699
"}]
commit_message:
Move files from mount points to actual file systems

The thing is that sometimes we have file system images and mount
point hierachies which are not aligned. Let's say, we have root
file system image, while partition scheme says that two file
systems should be created on the node: / and /var. In this case
root image has /var directory with a set of files. Obviously, we
need to move all these files from /var directory on the root
file system to /var file system because /var directory will be
used as mount point.
In order to achieve this we mount all existent file systems into
a flat set of temporary directories. We then try to find
specific paths which correspond to mount points and move all
files from these paths to corresponding file systems.

Co-Authored-By: Alexey Stupnikov <astupnikov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I1aa7523055ac4bcf6f8a93e9740ccf652ed35cc1
Closes-Bug: #1537699

commit_message:
Support for *args/**kwargs was added to the MuranoPL

With this change MuranoPL is going to have abilities similar to
what Python has with *args/**kwargs.

The syntax is "Usage: VarArgs" and "Usage: KwArgs" applied to
the method arguments.

Implements blueprint: support-for-args-kwargs-in-muranopl

Change-Id: I1c19bde100778639ac1d31b0c9076d35999266ee

subject: Incorrect Method param inheritance was fixed
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-04-25 20:50:14.000000000', 'files': ['murano/dsl/yaql_integration.py', 'murano/dsl/executor.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_method_param_inheritance.py', 'murano/tests/unit/dsl/meta/TestMethodParamInheritance.yaml'], 'message': 'Incorrect Method param inheritance was fixed

When a class calls method that was overridden in a child
class in yaql context both implementation are present. So if
derived implementation happen to have another signature
normal yaql resolution rule will apply and both of them
can be called depending on the parameters. However
this is goes against MuranoPL design that prohibits
several versions of the same method to be accessible in
class hierarchy. With this fix derived implementation
will always signature with *args/**kwargs so it will
always match and take precedence over that from the base class

Closes-bug: #1572215
Change-Id: I0ce27d03d785675f166fd265bb30b3b70ca6c7cb
'}]
commit_message:
Incorrect Method param inheritance was fixed

When a class calls method that was overridden in a child
class in yaql context both implementation are present. So if
derived implementation happen to have another signature
normal yaql resolution rule will apply and both of them
can be called depending on the parameters. However
this is goes against MuranoPL design that prohibits
several versions of the same method to be accessible in
class hierarchy. With this fix derived implementation
will always signature with *args/**kwargs so it will
always match and take precedence over that from the base class

Closes-bug: #1572215
Change-Id: I0ce27d03d785675f166fd265bb30b3b70ca6c7cb

commit_message:
Allow insecure SSL communications with RabbitMQ

Add insecure option to [rabbitmq] section of murano.conf

This is a partial fix because it improves Engine <-> RMQ
 communications but the same problem exist on
 Agent <-> RMQ side

 Partial-Bug: #1578421

Change-Id: I55207c3016da12be45918a7dc33795abf69627b4

commit_message:
Fix usage of rest_client expected_success() in tests

rest_client expected_success() method expect read_code
must be int and states the same in doc string .

Tempest is converting that to error instead of false pass.
Details: I3f4c58bdbb172805514831103927d3464d65d7f3

Change-Id: Ic4b0af5701df99621e3abb693644c4824c92dc4c
(cherry picked from commit e8dda1db0ef72da1d98bf238a6da986729a91e41)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-17 09:16:38.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Change urllib3 version to urllib3>=1.15.1

Urllib3 1.15 introduced support for chunked transfer encoding, which
Tempest used to do with some custom code using the low-level httplib
module. Instead, it would be nice to rely on Urllib3 to do this.

Urllib3 release note:
https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/blob/master/CHANGES.rst#115-2016-04-06

requests is also bumped as part of this commit because it bundles
urllib3 and since most distros unbundle it the versions need to be

Change-Id: I255e70e6b680e3b61264b5cf49621c40f460ca8e
'}]
commit_message:
Change urllib3 version to urllib3>=1.15.1

Urllib3 1.15 introduced support for chunked transfer encoding, which
Tempest used to do with some custom code using the low-level httplib
module. Instead, it would be nice to rely on Urllib3 to do this.

Urllib3 release note:
https://github.com/shazow/urllib3/blob/master/CHANGES.rst#115-2016-04-06

requests is also bumped as part of this commit because it bundles
urllib3 and since most distros unbundle it the versions need to be
kept in sync.

Change-Id: I255e70e6b680e3b61264b5cf49621c40f460ca8e

- Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, see https://github.com/openSUSE/spec-cleaner/graphs/commit-activity

- Is the library good code?

Since its only a testing dep, this is less important.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes. SUSE packages it only as python3 module for their testing

- Is the library license compatible?

BSD, so yes.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

commit_message:
Add spec_cleaner for rpm-packaging style checks

- Is the library actively maintained?

Yes, see https://github.com/openSUSE/spec-cleaner/graphs/commit-activity

- Is the library good code?

Since its only a testing dep, this is less important.

- Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes. SUSE packages it only as python3 module for their testing

- Is the library license compatible?

BSD, so yes.

- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu
  latest / Fedora latest)?

No, but since its only a test dependency, this can come
as an afterthought.

- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
  in ``global-requirements.txt``?

Not that I'm aware of.

Change-Id: Ieb91a31f3706c66edeb37426b37a20e96d933f50

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-17 04:53:16.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "Add pydotplus for usage during testing

Why: this (optional) library is used to ensure that the pydot
     conversion of taskflow execution workflows into
     dot graphs (which can then be converted into svg or
     png or jpg) works as expected and can be verified during
     taskflow testing (this also applies for consuming projects
     that also want to use/verify pydot, ie consumers of taskflow
     or automaton such as ironic or octavia).

Is the library actively maintained?

  Not as much as I want it to be, but the dot format hasn't changed
  in years and as we encounter bugs I'm ok with trying to work with
  the author to fix them.

  Sure?

  MIT License

Is the library already packaged in the distros
we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

  Seems packaged on fedora, but not ubuntu.

Related-Bug: #1561656

Change-Id: Ia633ccd1dca94f70b05ae4376a1c3a3f252a9923
"}]
commit_message:
Add pydotplus for usage during testing

Why: this (optional) library is used to ensure that the pydot
     conversion of taskflow execution workflows into
     dot graphs (which can then be converted into svg or
     png or jpg) works as expected and can be verified during
     taskflow testing (this also applies for consuming projects
     that also want to use/verify pydot, ie consumers of taskflow
     or automaton such as ironic or octavia).

Is the library actively maintained?

  Not as much as I want it to be, but the dot format hasn't changed
  in years and as we encounter bugs I'm ok with trying to work with
  the author to fix them.

Is the library good code?

  Sure?

Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes

Is the library license compatible?

  MIT License

Is the library already packaged in the distros
we target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

  Seems packaged on fedora, but not ubuntu.

Is the function of this library already covered by other
libraries in global-requirements.txt?

  Nope

Related-Bug: #1561656

Change-Id: Ia633ccd1dca94f70b05ae4376a1c3a3f252a9923

commit_message:
Add Designate+Tempest on Mitaka jobs

* Allows gate-tempest-dsvm-designate-(powerdns|bind) to
  run on stable/mitaka.
* Adds gate-tempest-dsvm-designate-(powerdns|bind)-mitaka,
  which runs only on master of designate-tempest-plugin to
  check that master of the plugin works with stable/mitaka
  of the core codebase (non voting for now).

Change-Id: I554d4509d1a090234f4a92846e48c1f78260c56a
Depends-On: I58930c40243068e97ff8f6f1684cfbe5565ac7f1
Depends-On: If1f27eb43f014959551c298f10c6c5fcb95e2fe8

commit_message:
Expose plugin and plugin_context to mech_driver

This patch is a prerequisite for converting the OVN core plugin over to
a mech driver under patch:

    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/312705/

In order to convert update_network() and create/update/delete_port()
methods access to the plugin and plugin context is required.

Change-Id: I695cf51dedcc4f78464044c12c4064fad7c0b746
Partial-Bug: #1578198

commit_message:
Add tests for multipath devices

SSHManager.update_connection: add possibility to open new connection with
parameters, if no connection presents.

This testgroup should be run with this parameters:

    export MULTIPATH=True
    export SLAVE_MULTIPATH_DISKS_COUNT=2
    export MULTIPATH_TEMPLATE=system_test/tests_templates/tests_configs/multipath_3_nodes.yaml

Implements: blueprint test-multipath-devices

Change-Id: I73ffc4338b59c8b44eabe27b2d759b7fbbba19a4

commit_message:
Fix yaql conditions for case with empty vips hash

Plugins are able to override VIPs. So the situation when VIPs hash
is empty is quite possible and is used by some of existing plugins.
This patch makes yaql conditions properly handle such situations.

Change-Id: I426e8d8999d51468c9a85ed139ab10ab4397353c
Closes-bug: #1582151
(cherry picked from commit b0acf41ccf7b21ddca7fb8d4b1596c12a191c55a)

commit_message:
Add pyldap to g-r

pyldap is the python3 port of the python-ldap library. We should add this
as it is a drop-in replacement for python-ldap.

The library is actively maintained by Red Hat and a general community.

The library is PSF licensed, compatible with ASLv2 and OpenStack.

The library is used within Red Hat and therefore has active packaging work.
Other distros should not have a hard time packaging it if it is not included.

This library will replace python-ldap in the long run, so functionality is
duplicated. This library and python-ldap should not be co-installed since they
act in the same namespace. Pyldap is a drop-in replacement and therefore is
API compatible.

This is being added in an effort to get keystone to python 3 compat.

Change-Id: I330b9b8fd3b53a588f0a1ae0c7de16cf03adb3cd

when ofports are assigned to the interface. Previously we

Closes-Bug: #1560464

commit_message:
Watch for 'new' events in ovsdb monitor for ofport

This adjusts the event handling logic in the ovs interface
monitor to watch for 'new' events as well because this is
when ofports are assigned to the interface. Previously we
were only watching for 'insert' events, which would never
include the ofport so this led to every port being skipped
initially by the OVS agent and then picked up on the next
polling interval.

Closes-Bug: #1560464
Change-Id: I46ac508a839c6db779323d5afb083f3425f96e87
(cherry picked from commit 62e88623d977d28c113a1e29458621f82d48f6e5)

commit_message:
Add neutron profiles

Implements: blueprint refactor-puppet-manifests

Add neutron profiles for both pacemaker and non-ha.

HA profiles are designed such that they include the base
profiles, disabling features as needed, while the base
profile can be used independently.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Prince <dprince@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ida781badbcd63bbcb481a2170638aefe262b717b

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-17 09:47:26.000000000', 'files': ['imagebuild/tinyipa/finalise-tinyipa.sh'], 'message': 'TinyIPA: Ensure that kernel modules are loaded at boot

Installing packages into a chroot was not something tce-load was ever
designed for, because of this it gets a little confused about loading
kernel modules when we install them. This patch manually calls depmod to
ensure that the kernel modules we install during the build process get
loaded when we boot the ramdisk.

Change-Id: I940d11f3f9f2a39cba16e121dc1809a42690d350

commit_message:
TinyIPA: Ensure that kernel modules are loaded at boot

Installing packages into a chroot was not something tce-load was ever
designed for, because of this it gets a little confused about loading
kernel modules when we install them. This patch manually calls depmod to
ensure that the kernel modules we install during the build process get
loaded when we boot the ramdisk.

Change-Id: I940d11f3f9f2a39cba16e121dc1809a42690d350

Change-Id: Ib9581a6104d41f2cedbf00d085b8a46b15ceccbe
'}]
commit_message:
gnocchi: log on warning level, not exception

Logging with exception is an error level and is a bit violent,
considering error based on missing overlap can regularly happen. Having
warning as level is largely enough. No need to scare people.

Change-Id: Ib9581a6104d41f2cedbf00d085b8a46b15ceccbe

commit_message:
Resolve bug with long value to RANDSTR function.

There are any bugs in job status, when we use data source with invalid
urls, like:
 /user/hadoop/ti-%RANDSTR(4294967297)%-demo
It's impossible to create random string with this length, that's why I add
check to this value.

Change-Id: I8229e4eb4ace8f9cc551c77b6e5b23150967446f
Closes-bug: 1560890

commit_message:
radvd prefix configuration for DHCPV6_Stateful RA

When an IPv6 subnet's ipv6_ra_mode is set to DHCPV6_STATEFUL,
the hosts on that subnet rely on router advertisement for the
prefix length. This is important for subnets where the lengths
of the prefixes are not 64.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/linux/ra.py

Closes-Bug: #1531093
Change-Id: Ied8d390a05ee1a2e544e39e887abf11c8a56abc3
(cherry picked from commit 629d86d480c06569ba6bd5d9cd55a543dbf6221b)

subject: Add IPAllocation object to session info to stop GC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-23 14:54:46.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/db_base_plugin_common.py', 'neutron/db/models_v2.py'], 'message': "Add IPAllocation object to session info to stop GC

This adds the IPAllocation object created in the _store_ip_allocation
method to the session info dictionary to prevent it from being
immediately garbage collected. This is necessary because otherwise a
new persistent object will be created when the fixed_ips relationship
is referenced during the rest of the port create/update opertions.
This persistent object will then interfere with a retry operation
that uses the same session if it tries to create a conflicting record.

By preventing the object from being garbage collected, the reference
to fixed IPs will re-use the newly created sqlalchemy object instead
which will properly be cleaned up on a rollback.

This also removes the 'passive_delete' option from the fixed_ips
relationship on ports because IPAllocation objects would now be
left in the session after port deletes. At first glance, this might
look like a performance penalty because fixed_ips would be looked
up before port deletes; however, we already do that in the IPAM
code as well as the ML2 code so this relationship is already being
loaded on the delete_port operation.

Closes-Bug: #1556178
Change-Id: Ieee1343bb90cf111c55e00b9cabc27943b46c350
(cherry picked from commit 7d9169967fca3d81076cf60eb772f4506735a218)
"}]
commit_message:
Add IPAllocation object to session info to stop GC

This adds the IPAllocation object created in the _store_ip_allocation
method to the session info dictionary to prevent it from being
immediately garbage collected. This is necessary because otherwise a
new persistent object will be created when the fixed_ips relationship
is referenced during the rest of the port create/update opertions.
This persistent object will then interfere with a retry operation
that uses the same session if it tries to create a conflicting record.

By preventing the object from being garbage collected, the reference
to fixed IPs will re-use the newly created sqlalchemy object instead
which will properly be cleaned up on a rollback.

This also removes the 'passive_delete' option from the fixed_ips
relationship on ports because IPAllocation objects would now be
left in the session after port deletes. At first glance, this might
look like a performance penalty because fixed_ips would be looked
up before port deletes; however, we already do that in the IPAM
code as well as the ML2 code so this relationship is already being
loaded on the delete_port operation.

Closes-Bug: #1556178
Change-Id: Ieee1343bb90cf111c55e00b9cabc27943b46c350
(cherry picked from commit 7d9169967fca3d81076cf60eb772f4506735a218)

subject: Make agent interface plugging utilize network MTU
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 7787, 'name': 'Kevin Benton', 'email': 'kevin@benton.pub', 'username': 'blak111'}, {'_account_id': 8124, 'name': 'cbrandily', 'email': 'zzelle@gmail.com', 'username': 'cbrandily'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10692, 'name': 'Brocade Vyatta CI', 'email': 'DL-GRP-VYATTA-OSS@Brocade.com', 'username': 'brocade-oss-service', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14571, 'name': 'Intel Experimental CI', 'email': 'openstack-networking-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-19 14:44:56.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_dhcp_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/interface.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/router_info.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_interface.py', 'releasenotes/notes/end-to-end-mtu-00345fc4282cb8fb.yaml', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_router.py'], 'message': "Make agent interface plugging utilize network MTU

This changes the 'plug' and 'plug_new' interfaces of the
LinuxInterfaceDriver to accept an MTU argument. It then
updates the dhcp agent and l3 agent to pass the MTU that
is set on the network that the port belongs to. This allows
it to take into account the overhead calculations that are
done for encapsulation types.

It's necessary for the L3 agent to have the MTU because it
must recognize when fragmentation is needed so it can fragment
or generate an ICMP error.

It's necessary for the DHCP agent to have the MTU so it doesn't
interfere when it plugs into a bridge with a larger than 1500
MTU (the bridge would reduce its MTU to match the agent).

If an operator sets 'network_device_mtu', the value of that
will be used instead to preserve previous behavior.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py
	neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_router.py
	neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py
	neutron/agent/linux/interface.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_dhcp_agent.py

Additional modifications for Liberty:
- test_dvr_router_lifecycle_ha_with_snat_with_fips_nmtu renamed into
  test_dvr_router_lifecycle_without_ha_with_snat_with_fips_nmtu,
- the test validates DVR without HA.

Reason for the change: Liberty does not support DVR + HA routers (the
test raises DvrHaRouterNotSupported without those modifications).

Closes-Bug: #1549470
Closes-Bug: #1542108
Closes-Bug: #1542475
DocImpact: Neutron agents now support arbitrary MTU
           configurations on each network (including
           jumbo frames). This is accomplished by checking
           the MTU value defined for each network on which
           it is wiring VIFs.
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4df8d9a7016ab20fce235833d792b89309ec98a7)

===

Also squashing in the following fix to pass unit tests for midonet
interface driver:

Support interface drivers that don't support mtu parameter for plug_new

The method signature before Mitaka did not have the mtu= parameter. We
should continue supporting the old signature, since it can be used in
out of tree interface drivers. The class is part of public neutron API,
so we should make an effort to not break out of tree code.

Local modifications:
- don't issue a deprecation warning in minor release update.

Change-Id: I8e0c07c76fd0b4c55b66c20ebe29cdb7c07d6f27
Closes-Bug: #1570392
(cherry picked from commit 8a86ba1d014a5e758c0569aaf16cfe92492cc7f1)

Change-Id: Ic091fa78dfd133179c71cbc847bf955a06cb248a
"}]
commit_message:
Make agent interface plugging utilize network MTU

This changes the 'plug' and 'plug_new' interfaces of the
LinuxInterfaceDriver to accept an MTU argument. It then
updates the dhcp agent and l3 agent to pass the MTU that
is set on the network that the port belongs to. This allows
it to take into account the overhead calculations that are
done for encapsulation types.

It's necessary for the L3 agent to have the MTU because it
must recognize when fragmentation is needed so it can fragment
or generate an ICMP error.

It's necessary for the DHCP agent to have the MTU so it doesn't
interfere when it plugs into a bridge with a larger than 1500
MTU (the bridge would reduce its MTU to match the agent).

If an operator sets 'network_device_mtu', the value of that
will be used instead to preserve previous behavior.

Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_ha_router.py
	neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_router.py
	neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py
	neutron/agent/linux/interface.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py
	neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_dhcp_agent.py

Additional modifications for Liberty:
- test_dvr_router_lifecycle_ha_with_snat_with_fips_nmtu renamed into
  test_dvr_router_lifecycle_without_ha_with_snat_with_fips_nmtu,
- the test validates DVR without HA.

Reason for the change: Liberty does not support DVR + HA routers (the
test raises DvrHaRouterNotSupported without those modifications).

Closes-Bug: #1549470
Closes-Bug: #1542108
Closes-Bug: #1542475
DocImpact: Neutron agents now support arbitrary MTU
           configurations on each network (including
           jumbo frames). This is accomplished by checking
           the MTU value defined for each network on which
           it is wiring VIFs.
Co-Authored-By: Matt Kassawara <mkassawara@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4df8d9a7016ab20fce235833d792b89309ec98a7)

===

Also squashing in the following fix to pass unit tests for midonet
interface driver:

Support interface drivers that don't support mtu parameter for plug_new

The method signature before Mitaka did not have the mtu= parameter. We
should continue supporting the old signature, since it can be used in
out of tree interface drivers. The class is part of public neutron API,
so we should make an effort to not break out of tree code.

Local modifications:
- don't issue a deprecation warning in minor release update.

Change-Id: I8e0c07c76fd0b4c55b66c20ebe29cdb7c07d6f27
Closes-Bug: #1570392
(cherry picked from commit 8a86ba1d014a5e758c0569aaf16cfe92492cc7f1)

===

Change-Id: Ic091fa78dfd133179c71cbc847bf955a06cb248a

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-01 14:35:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_external_net.py'], 'message': "fix _validate_shared_update for dvr router ports

When trying to update external network from shared to not,
_validate_shared_update will be called to validate ports
on external network to confirm that, except router ports,
there is no port from other tenants. If some other tenants
ports still exist on external network, shared attribute

However, current _validate_shared_update will only ignore router
ports with device_owner such as DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_GW and
DEVICE_OWNER_FLOATINGIP when query ports, but indeed ports with

(cherry picked from commit 08d720e1caed67364b0e4859f03a861b233075e6)

commit_message:
fix _validate_shared_update for dvr router ports

When trying to update external network from shared to not,
_validate_shared_update will be called to validate ports
on external network to confirm that, except router ports,
there is no port from other tenants. If some other tenants
ports still exist on external network, shared attribute
updating will fail.

However, current _validate_shared_update will only ignore router
ports with device_owner such as DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_GW and
DEVICE_OWNER_FLOATINGIP when query ports, but indeed ports with
device_owner such as DEVICE_OWNER_AGENT_GW and DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_SNAT
should be skipped, otherwise an empty tenant_id like '' will cause
_validate_shared_update fails to work as expected.

Change-Id: Ibf5daf14192ce51d4e9ce10dc0c806ea230adec3
Closes-Bug: #1522482
(cherry picked from commit 08d720e1caed67364b0e4859f03a861b233075e6)

commit_message:
Switch to 'then' promise chains

It's planned to migrate to native promises instead of jQuery
Deferreds. This patch removes usage of .done(), .fail() and
.always() calls which don't exist in native promises.

Change-Id: I36ecd3a7698190c96ff9ac52fce940fa63f810c9

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-19 20:07:43.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': 'Don't log signals events with "Unknown" reason

This results in non-informative messages when listing events for
multiple SignalResponder resources, which look like:

SIGNAL_COMPLETE Unknown

Switching "Unknown" to say a signal was recieved and the name
of the resource is more informative/accurate.

Change-Id: I6558a895a4e6f3b65ed656ff775e5ccfbc980fad
'}]
commit_message:
Don't log signals events with "Unknown" reason

This results in non-informative messages when listing events for
multiple SignalResponder resources, which look like:

SIGNAL_COMPLETE Unknown

Switching "Unknown" to say a signal was recieved and the name
of the resource is more informative/accurate.

Use constraint option in tox.ini

Now, all python jobs support constraints since the following change is merged.
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/278335/
We don't need anymore the new constraint target in tox.

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2016-04-01 08:09:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py'], 'message': 'Move DHCP updates onto worker thread, coalesce port updates

Original review by Neil:
Id3a3dd96ed99242e8b7d62ea9e16d1a666a73885

In the original patch from Neil, all operations were collected
in a Queue and executed in a separate thread. During review
Kevin proposed an alternate mechanism just for port updates and
deletes. This review implements that strategy. We just mark
the network as dirty when we get a port update/delete. Then
in the thread, we call reload_allocations for each dirty
network. The original review queued up cheap operations
unnecessarily, while this review ends up with a reduction in
reload calls without any queue management logic.

Co-Authored-By: Kevin Benton <kevin@benton.pub>
Co-Authored-By: Neil Jerram <Neil.Jerram@metaswitch.com>
Related-Bug: #1453350
Change-Id: I304efdccbaed3f4e9dbc3cb7268cc28b2b0baed9
'}]
commit_message:
Move DHCP updates onto worker thread, coalesce port updates

Original review by Neil:
Id3a3dd96ed99242e8b7d62ea9e16d1a666a73885

In the original patch from Neil, all operations were collected
in a Queue and executed in a separate thread. During review
Kevin proposed an alternate mechanism just for port updates and
deletes. This review implements that strategy. We just mark
the network as dirty when we get a port update/delete. Then
in the thread, we call reload_allocations for each dirty
network. The original review queued up cheap operations
unnecessarily, while this review ends up with a reduction in
reload calls without any queue management logic.

Co-Authored-By: Kevin Benton <kevin@benton.pub>
Co-Authored-By: Neil Jerram <Neil.Jerram@metaswitch.com>
Related-Bug: #1453350
Change-Id: I304efdccbaed3f4e9dbc3cb7268cc28b2b0baed9

commit_message:
Handle common and seperate tempest tox venvs

In order to support the effort to unify the tox venvs being created
by tempest this commit temporarily cases the path of the venv being
created. Once tempest is updated to only use .tox/tempest we can
remove the if blocks and just use it unconditionally.

Change-Id: I34a69020eee07156e64026781a3c0bffdb5ab415

commit_message:
Optimise tinyipa boot time

This patch reduces tinyipa boot time significantly by preinstalling all
required system packages at build time instead of the traditional
tinycorelinux method of loading them at runtime, cutting many seconds
of unpacking squashfs files out of the boot procedure.

Change-Id: If10cb64ea6b64972df0cdbd1056d84f136fec94a
(cherry picked from commit 046994a04f5f2804091fbdf2d425019bb7b64952)

commit_message:
Clean up deprecated nova endpoints

Upstream puppet-nova patch I8990ce21745fa7a995b92ed337622fa6ffc2756b has
removed deprecated nova endpoints (ec2api, v3 and v2.0) and switched
to use a new nova endpoint for v2.1 API version.

commit_message:
Setup for using the Grenade 'early_create' phase

 * Create a 'devstack/upgrade/resources.sh' file to be used by
   Grenade.
 * Create an 'early_create' phase to call the create_ovs_tap()
   function.
 * Refactor the create_ovs_tap() function to accept an argument for
   the network to use.

Change-Id: I0efe427a7023d0336f25856c362c655c138102df

commit_message:
Allow the server name limit to be configurable

For some deployments 53 may be to high of a value and
a lower value may be used (ie for registration into active
directory, which has lower name limits) so add the ability
to reduce the valid length of server names (but
preserve the current limits by default).

Change-Id: Icd06aba14dbf156b9164b0e25233f2df7099fc9b

commit_message:
Stop engine service correctly

If SIGINT received right after start of heat engine, in the middle
of start() method, heat engine can not stop correctly. Clean up only
those resources that actually exist.

Change-Id: I496f6284e15b4f71b166cc0713cfd41423cce400
Closes-Bug: #1562042
(cherry picked from commit 151e8b8e62a508f07e4a67bee2418e4965c59944)

subject: Add CLIFF_MAX_TERM_WIDTH envvar to complement --max-width
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 16318, 'name': 'Vincent Legoll', 'email': 'vincent.legoll@iphc.cnrs.fr', 'username': 'vincentleg'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-08 11:44:44.000000000', 'files': ['cliff/formatters/table.py', 'cliff/tests/test_formatters_table.py'], 'message': 'Add CLIFF_MAX_TERM_WIDTH envvar to complement --max-width

Some cliff clients tailors their output according to characteristics
of the terminal they outputs text to. They detect the width of the
terminal in order to pretty print text properly cut to line length.

There are situations where the output is not in a "real" terminal
but in some kind of emulation or redirected layer for which this
line length interpretation is not ideal. For example in a bash
jupyter-notebook.

There already exist the --max-width CLI parameter to allow that
to be customized, but there are cases where you don't want to
use an additional parameter. So add an environment variable
that has the same meaning, to help avoiding the use of
--max-width.

Without the parameter nor the envvar, the behaviour should stay
the same as before the patch, i.e. the output is cut to terminal
line length. The envvar is then used to give the parameter's
default value, so the parameter will stay being the final one
deciding of the behaviour when used.

Add mock'ed testing for the new CLIFF_MAX_TERM_WIDTH envvar.
Add mock'ed tests to ensure parameter vs envvar priority.
Add testing for actual parameter parsing & priority vs envvar.²

This has been discussed in:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-openstackclient/+bug/1577368
https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-cliff/+bug/1485847/comments/7

Closes-Bug: 1577368
Related-Bug: 1485847

Change-Id: I0ab988ea0e7087960a9bfb2353f46918f0333a53
Signed-off-by: Vincent Legoll <vincent.legoll@idgrilles.fr>
'}]
commit_message:
Add CLIFF_MAX_TERM_WIDTH envvar to complement --max-width

Some cliff clients tailors their output according to characteristics
of the terminal they outputs text to. They detect the width of the
terminal in order to pretty print text properly cut to line length.

There are situations where the output is not in a "real" terminal
but in some kind of emulation or redirected layer for which this
line length interpretation is not ideal. For example in a bash
jupyter-notebook.

There already exist the --max-width CLI parameter to allow that
to be customized, but there are cases where you don't want to
use an additional parameter. So add an environment variable
that has the same meaning, to help avoiding the use of
--max-width.

Without the parameter nor the envvar, the behaviour should stay
the same as before the patch, i.e. the output is cut to terminal
line length. The envvar is then used to give the parameter's
default value, so the parameter will stay being the final one
deciding of the behaviour when used.

Add mock'ed testing for the new CLIFF_MAX_TERM_WIDTH envvar.
Add mock'ed tests to ensure parameter vs envvar priority.
Add testing for actual parameter parsing & priority vs envvar.²

This has been discussed in:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-openstackclient/+bug/1577368
https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-cliff/+bug/1485847/comments/7

Closes-Bug: 1577368
Related-Bug: 1485847

Change-Id: I0ab988ea0e7087960a9bfb2353f46918f0333a53
Signed-off-by: Vincent Legoll <vincent.legoll@idgrilles.fr>

commit_message:
Add test for etckeeper plugin

1. Revert snapshot with 1 node
2. Download and install fuel-plugin-builder
3. Clone plugin repo
4. Build plugin
5. Install plugin to fuel
6. Create cluster and enable plugin
7. Deploy cluster
8. Check plugin

commit_message:
trivial: removed unused networks var from os-tenant-networks:create

This simply removes an unused variable from the create method
in the os-tenant-networks API.

Note that this is also in the legacy v2 API extension code but
that's going to be removed so I'm not fixing it here.
